page.title: 17THE A96. GOLLANFIELD
page.content: Going straight through{Gollanfield}is the{A96.}It has had people pleading for improvement for many years,but not much has been done about it. Infact, quite a majority of schoolchildren used to have to cross the{A96}to get to school,but because of the amount and speed of the traffic they were switched to a taxi.That was in 1982. Still nothing has been done. It has actually come to a district councillor writing to the P.M,Mrs Thatcher, saying how many accidents occur in a year.The reply was disappointing, a secretary from Downing street said that they are sorry but they cannot help. But there are minor improvements due to be carried out on the road.Can't we even turn for help to the highest authorities?
